title: General
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

Identification (1 point)

  • Populations I and III

Justification (1 point)

  • The error bars/95 percent confidence intervals for populations I and III do not overlap

  • (Sample mean + 2 SEM of population I) < (Sample mean − 2 SEM of population III)
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

2 points maximum

  • Populations I and III

Justification (1 point)

  • The error bars/95 percent confidence intervals for populations I and III do not overlap

  • (Sample mean + 2 SEM of population I) < (Sample mean − 2 SEM of population III)

Student response earns one of the available points.

2 points maximum

Identification (1 point)

  • Populations I and III

Justification (1 point)

  • The error bars/95 percent confidence intervals for populations I and III do not overlap

  • (Sample mean + 2 SEM of population I) < (Sample mean − 2 SEM of population III)

Student response earns two of the available points.

2 points maximum

Identification (1 point)

  • Populations I and III

Justification (1 point)

  • The error bars/95 percent confidence intervals for populations I and III do not overlap

  • (Sample mean + 2 SEM of population I) < (Sample mean − 2 SEM of population III)
